caption:
The photograph depicts a large, deforested area on a sloping hillside, likely the result of logging activity. The ground is covered with scattered remnants of tree trunks and broken branches, appearing as white and pale gray fragments against the brown, earthy background of the soil. This debris is distributed unevenly across the terrain, creating a disorganized and desolate appearance.

The scene is set in a rugged mountainous landscape. On either side of the deforested area, dense forests of green coniferous trees can be seen, suggesting that the location is part of a larger woodland region. The harsh impact of the logging is starkly visible as a sharp contrast to the untouched nature surrounding it.

A winding dirt road cuts through the landscape from the bottom right to the center of the image, enhancing the sense of depth and leading the viewer's eye through the scene. The road appears to be the main access way for vehicles, possibly used for transporting timber.

In the background, the mountains recede into a hazy, possibly smoke-filled atmosphere, adding a sense of depth and vastness to the environment. The overall mood conveyed by the image is one of poignant environmental impact, highlighting the transformative and often disruptive influence of human activity in natural settings.
title: Atercourse in the canyon river drainage system in olympic national timberland, Washington.  Near Olympic National Park
